Description: Dianik Bross Shipping Corp., S.A., and Chief Engineer Vassili Samoilenko were sentenced yesterday after pleading guilty to felony charges concerning violations of international and national oil pollution laws that occurred on a large bulk carrier called the M/V Kostas N, United States Attorney Melinda Haag announced. As part of a plea agreement, the company was ordered to pay $650,000, with $150,000 of the monies going to environmental projects in the Bay Area.
